com.team08storyapp

Class Annotation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.team08storyapp.Annotation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Annotation
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Annotation is a model class representing a reader's Annotations on a Particular Story Fragment. An Annotation has the following properties:
    • Annotation Id to uniquely identify the Annotation.
    • Story Fragment Id the Id identified with the Story Fragment the Annotation belongs to.
    • Photo the photo the reader set in the Annotation.
    • Encoded Annotation is the Annotation encoded for storing it in a file or on a webservice.
    These properties are able to be accessed through the constructor or through public getters/setters.

    A user while reading a Story online or offline has the option to view or add Annotations to each Story Fragment they read. The Annotation is created in the form of a illustration or photo. The user can either add this by taking a picture or uploading it from their phones gallery.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0 November 8, 2013
    Author:
    Michele Paulichuk, Alice Wu, Ana Marcu, Jarrett Toll, Jiawei Shen
    See Also:
    StoryFragment, Photo, Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getAnnotationID()
      This getter method gets the unique identifier for the Annotation.
      java.lang.String getEncodedAnnotation()
      This getter method retrieves the encoded Annotation used for storing the Annotation either on the webservice or local file system as photos need to be stored as encoded byte arrays.
      java.lang.String getPhoto()
      This getter method gets the photo that the user chose for the Annotation.
      int getStoryFragmentID()
      This getter method gets the unique identifier Story Fragment that the Annotation belongs to.
      void setAnnotationID(int annotationID)
      This setter method sets the unique identifier for the Annotation.
      void setEncodedAnnotation(java.lang.String encodedAnnotation)
      Annotation will be encoded from without the class and then this setter method sets it in the Annotation object to for future use for the Annotation to be stored outside the application.
      void setPhoto(java.lang.String photo)
      This setter method sets the photo that the user chose for the Annotation.
      void setStoryFragmentID(int storyFragmentID)
      This setter method sets the unique identifier Story Fragment that the Annotation belongs to.

      • setEncodedAnnotation

        public void setEncodedAnnotation(java.lang.String encodedAnnotation)
        Annotation will be encoded from without the class and then this setter method sets it in the Annotation object to for future use for the Annotation to be stored outside the application.
        Parameters:
        encodedAnnotation - The encodedAnnotation to set representing the Annotation.
